data.title: Fine Historic Hotel
data.text:
This was our first time to visit the State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations (very cool that the smallest state has the longest name) and we were thrilled to be able to stay right in the heart of Providence in a fine old hotel with excellent staff, an awesome lobby, and comfortable and quirky rooms. 

The location was perfect for us--we were there for the November 5 WaterFire--just a short walk from the hotel. 

I am an architect who likes the idea of preserving great old buildings like the Biltmore--I realize that everyone may not share my love of old buildings--but if you do, this is a very nice property.

data.title: Met expectations
data.text: Good location in Providence, but some of the staff need better information and professionalism. I had some wonderful conversations and some disappointing ones with staff during our stay. It was nice to have a restaurant bar and Starbucks in the lobby!

data.title: A bit dated needs a refit
data.text: While the staff are good and the room size is huge, the bathroom was tiny and down a long corridor in the room, WiFi signal was poor and the décor in the room and communal areas was looking tired. The food in the restaurant was good.

data.title: Great location and staff
data.text: The staff at the Providence Biltmore were so accomodating and helpful-we were offered water upon check-in and after coming back from our run and also upon check-in were given recommendations for getting around the city and restaurants. The hotel is historic and beautiful.

data.title: Beautiful hotel, superb customer service!
data.text: We were here for a wedding. From checkin to checkout everything was easy and every single employee we came in contact with was pleasant and helpful. The food was to die for (and having a Starbucks in the lobby is always a plus!) And we wanted to take that mattress home lol it was crazy comfortable! Thanks for a great weekend! Will definitely visit again!

data.title: Comfortable Stay
data.text: The Biltmore is an impressive property. The staff was helpful, courteous and professional. Everything you would expect from a Hilton property. On site restaurant/bar is good (McCormick & Schmick's) a little pricey. I stayed here for the ambiance and a little step back in time. Doesn't disappoint. Location is perfect for downtown. I would stay again and recommend for a business or family in town. There some bells and whistles missing, but you'll survive.

data.title: Best Wedding Location Ever
data.text: proud to have had my prohibition themed wedding at the biltmeor the over the top feeling for astonishment and amazement of the grand ballroom was above and beyond any conceivable imagination. every guest that came to the wedding couldn't have been happier with the venue.

data.title: Great massages by Julie at the Hotel Spa!!
data.text:
I moved to Providence about 3 years ago and I actually live around the corner from the hotel.  It's a great neighborhood and if you are staying at the Biltmore you should get out and explore!

I am a weekend warrior athlete and I usually get about 2 massages/month to deal with post workout soreness.  I tried a bunch of massages places around Providence and then one week I had an amazing massage with Julie N. at the Biltmore.  Since then, no one else will do!

Julie is absolute pro - she knows how to adjust her technique for whatever I've injured/overworked that week, and always makes sure to communicate with me so that I get the most out of the session. (And, she knows where all the knots are!!) In addition, she's kind and friendly and always has a smile and something nice to say, which adds to the experience of relaxation and rejuvenation.  I consider her a friend and I'm lucky to be one of her regulars!

 You should definitely go see Julie if you are staying at the hotel.  Just don't take my spot!  :-)

data.title: Family stay at the Biltmore
data.text: Large suite with 2 king beds and separate sitting area was perfect fit traveling with kids.   No free breakfast like so many hotels nor but plenty of great options in easy walking distance.  High floors get you away from construction and street noise.

data.title: I Love the Biltmore & their Staff!
data.text: I came to Rhode Island with my 17 year old daughter to tour the Universities in Providence. It's a very stressful time trying to find the right University for your daughter to spend 4 years of her life in. Kathy at the front desk could have not been more helpful assisting me and my daughter find our way around the city and making us feel at home at the Biltmore. I will be staying here again.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review the Providence Bitlmore.  It is so nice to hear that Kathy had such a great impact on you and your daughters stay.  We know how stressful this time can be for parents and children and hope it was a successful trip.  We look forward to seeing you again soon and possible much more through the next 4 years.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Inconvenient, Dated, and Limited
data.text: Positives:  The bed was comfortable, clean, and staff was friendly.  Negatives:  Personal taste- but the hotel décor, furniture, and rooms overall are dated. Thus the reason it falls under the Curio collection.  So if you like charm and character, this may be the place for you.  The doors look like they have been painted over 100 times without being sanded down and are original to the building.  The bathroom doesn't have a "fan", the door opens into the toilet.  The building operates on an old heat/cooling system so my room was a little cool but I sleep better that way anyway.  The furniture in the room is dated, so, uncomfortable.  There is a $20 fee to park overnight with an inconvenient walk into an alley to get to the parking garage, or you have to pay $29 to have it parked for you.  Your only option for food within the building was an expensive restaurant, McCormick, or otherwise Starbucks.  Short of a Subway across the street you'd have to walk a ways crossing busy intersections in hopes of finding an alternative.  The room shared no other options of food in the vicinity or pizza delivery as an option.  Overall, inconvenient place to stay unless everything your doing is within walking distance from this hotel.  I will not be staying again.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback on our comfortable, clean beds and friendly staff.  I am confused as to the "inconvenient comment". If there is one trend that shines true through on our online reviews it is how centrally located our Property is to many different restaurants, stores and activities.  There are at least 20 restaurant within a 1/4 of a mile of our hotel.  There are another 15 delivery options from pizza to sandwiches to Asian cuisine.  There is a four story mall with pretty much every store imaginable .  There are  many other local shops and designers as well as theaters, concert halls and museums all within a mile radius.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Room configuraton wierd...
data.text: Our stay was pleasant overall.  The room configuration is very odd with the bathroom entrance in the kitchen and the closet in the living/sitting room.  Most of the service was professional and pleasant.    We travel to RI periodically and will not return to this hotel...the room was expensive, the view was of the parking lot and the configuration of the room was really wierd

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to share.  I apologize that the room was not to your satisfaction.  We do have many different styles of rooms to choose from.  Some of our guest favorites or the two king bed junior suites or our King bed Biltmore suite.  The are spacious and practically designed.  I hope you will consider us again and please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly to help in your booking process.  I am certain we can provide something you would enjoy.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Highest of Compliments
data.text: I chose The Providence Biltmore as the sight to propose to my longtime girlfriend.  Leading up to the weekend, I was in contact with two associates, Naomi and Eric, who could not have been more helpful in special arrangement requests.  While I am an HHonors Gold Member I sincerely wanted to stay at the Biltmore because I was looking for a weekend to remember - it was surely a bonus to stay at a line of hotel where I was a member.  The Grande Suite was wonderful, the views amazing, the accommodations excellent.  I would sincerely refer everyone I know to the Biltmore and highlight the charm and nostalgia it offers while upholding the highest quality service.  While we are looking to have a long engagement I would love to hold our wedding at the Providence Biltmore.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for such high praises Peter.  What a wonderful event for you and your new fiancee.  We are so happy to be able to assist in this memorable moment.  SO happy to hear you enjoyed the GRAND SUITE with Amazing views and Excellent Accommodations.  We truly hope to be able to host you and you family and friends on the next step in this life journey.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very nice hotel
data.text: The check in and check out process were both quick and easy. Hotel staff was very polite and helpful. The room was even ready before the posted check-in time. Hotel had a very classic and historical feel.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review the Providence Biltmore. We appreciate you kind words on our polite and helpful staff.  Glad to hear you enjoyed our very classic and historic feeling hotel.  We look forward to having you with us again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wedding party!
data.text: Loved the hotel, and the beautiful room! Hotel is centrally located and the staff is wonderful! The parking attendants and the front desk staff were so nice and helpful. Very very professional. Lots to do in the area, surrounded by many places to eat, and drink.  I would recommend staying here for any event you have in Providence!

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your experience at the Providence Biltmore.  We will be sure to pass on your kinds words on our Wondeful Staff and centrally located hotel.   We appreciate your recommendation to stay here for any Providence event
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Classic old hotel in downtown
data.text: Nice large rooms, beautiful old classic hotel in downtown Providence. Little run down in lobby.  Across from bus station.  Great valet service for car.  Easy walking to Brown Univ., restaurants, bars, etc.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  Our location is very close to the train station, Brown University, RISD, The providence place mall and many excellent restaurants.  It is great to hear you enjoyed or NICE LARGE ROOMS and Great Valet Service.  We look forward to having you with us again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Our favorite hotel in Providence
data.text: Our daughter attends college in Prov, so we come frequently for athletics. By far our favorite hotel in the city. Walk to anything and no other hotels offers 2 king beds. The desk, the valet always friendly. Starbucks directly attached is nice too. View on odd room number side is awesome.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate you choosing the Providence Biltmore as your Favorite Hotel in Providence.  And you are right, there is no other hotel that offers rooms with 2 KING BEDS.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing much more of you and your family.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Portland Biltmore provides history and a lovely staff service
data.text: Friendly and welcoming from the time we drive up in our car to the time we left,  Big suites for a enjoyable, comfortable business trip with room to spread out or a family trip with children. Loved the historical feel and location.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Providence Biltmore.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed our big suites.  They definitely fit the needs of all different types of travelers.  We look forward to seeing you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice hotel
data.text: Clean, staff very helpful.  Some fixtures in room could be updated.  LIKED THAT THERE WAS A LOUNGE PORTION OF THE ROOM.  complimentary Managers special was nice.  Hotel restaurant is nice with nice bar and bar staff.

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your experience at the Providence Biltmore.  We appreciate your kind words on our very helpful staff.  It was great having you with us for our Managers reception.  This is something our managers and guest truly seem to enjoy.  We hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Going above and beyond!
data.text: Recently stayed here while on a business trip. I typically don't write reviews, but feel compelled to do so to acknowledge Eric Berlind for making my stay extraordinary and exceeding my expectations. Last minute, my home office called me up for a video conference, but I was already scheduled to check out of the hotel. I was concerned about not having a private, quiet place where I could hold the video conference. I approached Eric about my situation, he truly went above and beyond the call of duty. He offered me a private, quiet space that ended up being perfect. I was comfortable and relaxed, in the end I had a great meeting and a successful business trip. I can see why the staff at this property deliver quality customer service that lives up to the Hilton name. Thanks Eric!

owner_response.author: Erik B, Front Office Manager at Providence Biltmore, Curio Collection by Hilton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing such a great service moment.  I am so happy to hear we were able to put something together so last minute and that it worked out so well.  Empowering our staff to go above and beyond it something we promote daily.  It is always nice to see our efforts paying off.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
